page.title: 09FIRST IMPRESSIONS
page.content: Our area which takes in Rottingdean, East Ovingdean, Saltdean and the southern tip of Woodingdean is dominated by the Downs. The residential areas had their beginnings in the valley where Rottingdean is situated, the only natural valley between Brighton and Newhaven. Large areas are farmland. From the Beacon Hill windmill one can see how the residential areas have spread. North of Rottingdean and Saltdean the Downs are also untouched. The housing in this area is varied in style, dating from the 16th century in Rottingdean to the newer bungalows on the hills at Woodingdean and Saltdean.
